channel.title: ln(exun) - Consolidated Feed
channel.description: Consolidated feed from ln(exun) - Natural log of Exun Clan, the computer club at DPS RK Puram.

Girls in Tech
item.description: We are delighted to announce our collaboration this year with Girl Code It, an international non-profit organization for our Girls in Tech event. It is open to girls (inclusive) of all grades, and there are no prerequisites for participation : ) (Also open to students of Delhi Public School, RK Puram of all grades)

item.title: Junior Girls in Tech
item.description: We are proud to announce that this year’s Junior Girls in Tech event is in collaboration with the renowned NPO Women Who Code, Delhi chapter! The currently ongoing event is open to girls (inclusive) of grades 6-9, and there are no prerequisites required. (Also open to students of Delhi Public School, RK Puram)

item.title: Build
item.description: Exun 2021-22 is back with Build, the perfect event to put your innovation and creativity to the test. An amalgamation of 3 sub-events- Hackathon, Designathon and Unreality-, it encompasses a variety of fields from 2D design to 3D modelling, WebDev to GameDev, Audio Production and much more. Head over to https://reg.exun.co/invite/events for more info!

item.title: Virtualization — Hitaarth Soni
item.description: Virtualization is the practice of creating a virtual version of something, including virtual computer hardware platforms, storage devices, and computer network resources according to Wikipedia. But in Layman’s terms, it’s creating computer hardware virtually in a container or Virtual Machine. This technology was invented in the 1960s is credited to Jim Rymarczyk who was working … Continue reading Virtualization — Hitaarth Soni →

item.title: Sudocrypt v11.0
item.description: With exciting levels, a brand new format, and over INR 50,000 ($700) in cash prizes, Exun Clan, the technology club of Delhi Public School, R.K. Puram, is back with its annual international Cryptic Hunt x Capture the Flag (CTF) event, Sudocrypt! Sudocrypt v11.0 will be held over 48 hours from 00:00:01 on 10th January 2022 … Continue reading Sudocrypt v11.0 →

item.title: SpaceTech is back!
item.description: Interested in adapting exciting tech in unpredictable conditions of space? Check out the prompt and format at exun.co/spacetech NOW! Over the years, the evolution of technology has been witnessed, from typewriters to digital systems such as a computer, telephones have evolved into portable smartphones. Progress in technology means pushing the boundaries of what is possible, … Continue reading SpaceTech is back! →

item.title: SpaceTech Deadline Extension
item.description: Please note that the SpaceTech prelims submission deadline has now been extended 10th January, 2022. Best of Luck!

item.title: Exun 2021-22 is back!
item.description: Have you picked up on the buzz? Are you tired of the same old run-of-the-mill contests? Search no further; Exun 2021-22 hosts a wide array of activities. With over 25 events, and exciting prizes at stake, there’s something for everyone. Hurry up! Register at reg.exun.co/invite.

item.title: Exun 2021-22 The Quick Lookup
item.description: Pop it out to view it closely – Keep double clicking for Zooming into it for closure view – Use Left-Right-Up-Down Keys to view various event in Zoomed in view.

item.title: Exun 2021-22
item.description: A moment we’ve all been waiting for, Exun is back — bigger, better, international for a second time, and the most open and accessible it has ever been. We bring to you Exun 2021-22: celebrating 26 years of India’s biggest high school tech symposium! With over 25 events, ranging from disciplines like web development, machine … Continue reading Exun 2021-22 →

item.title: Blender 3.0 Release Commemoration Video
item.description: Exun Clan has been using Blender 3D for over a decade, from when it was in its early days to today, and we’ve made a short video appreciating the software as it reaches its landmark 3.0 release: https://youtu.be/4YYhhQsO_J8 Made by Exun Clan with in-house assets and creations made using Blender3D, the free and open-source 3D … Continue reading Blender 3.0 Release Commemoration Video →

Concluding Ceremony
item.description: Greetings!Exun 2020 is coming to an end; It’s been an eventful and enjoyable week for all. To mark the conclusion of the event, you are cordially invited to the closing ceremony of Exun 2020, which will take place tomorrow, 22nd November, 5 PM IST onwards. The ceremony will consist of the felicitation of participants, along … Continue reading Concluding Ceremony →

item.title: Exun talk
item.description: Greetings! We would like to invite all of you to the Last Exun Talk, which is scheduled for today(Saturday), 21st November, at 5pm IST. The talk will be delivered by Exun Alumnus Aarman Roy. It requires no prerequisites and can be attended at https://exun.co/talks.

item.title: Exun Alumni
item.description: Interested in interacting with Exun Alumni who have together worked at Microsoft, Facebook, Flipkart, WhatsApp, Apple, Google and Uber through the course of their careers? Want to know more about building good products and working in the technology landscape? Exun is organising a Fireside Chat just for you! Tune in at 10AM on Sunday, 22nd … Continue reading Exun Alumni →

item.title: e-Lite 2018 Common Round Qualifiers
item.description: This year the selection process was fairly subjective. There was a clear difference in cutoffs for different classes. Someone who scored less than you may have qualified and you may not have, but other factors like very high scores in a particular section could have led to their qualification. The selection process this year was […]

item.title: Exun e-Lite 2018 Learning Resources
item.description: Exun Clan will soon hold e-Lite, our annual recruitment test, open to anyone from classes 6–11 (and to exceptional students from class 12). This year, rather than having a separate recruitment test for each discipline (quizzing, programming, creative, and group discussion), we’re going to integrate the induction process. Although the final details of the recruitment process […]

item.title: Will Uber be consumed by its own fire?
item.description: “His biggest strength is that he will run through a wall to accomplish his goals, His biggest weakness is that he will run through a wall to accomplish his goals.”   That’s how a New York Times article described Travis Kalanick, the ex-CEO of Uber. Travis founded Uber in 2009, and his last employee address […]

item.title: Mafia 3
item.description: Released in October 2016, Mafia 3 is probably the best game in the Mafia series so far. Developed by Hangar 13 and published by 2K Games, the third installment in the Mafia franchise typically focuses on a huge open world environment . Unlike the previous games in the series, it focuses on the aspects of […]

item.title: A Basic Introduction to Machine Learning Algorithms
item.description: A Basic Introduction to Machine Learning Algorithms Machine learning is a field in computer science, which gives computers the ability to learn without explicitly being programmed to do so, and has widespread applications across several fields, such as diagnosis of diseases, optical character recognition, computer vision and email filtering. Many machine learning techniques are in-fact […]

item.title: The Future of Computing Lies In The Cloud
item.description: THE FUTURE OF COMPUTING LIES IN THE CLOUD Cloud computing, often referred to as simply “the cloud,” is the delivery of on-demand computing resources — everything from applications to data centers — over the internet on a pay-for-use basis. It uses a remote server connected to the client by internet for using services like storage, […]

item.title: The Music Revolution
item.description: Spotify was founded by Daniel Ek and Martin Lorentzon in Sweden, and currently, has 140 million users. Pandora Internet Radio was founded by Will Glaser, Jon Kraft and Tim Westergren and currently, has 81 million users Apple Music is Apple’s streaming service and was introduced in mid-2015 and has and currently, has 30 million users […]

item.title: The Journey of Pendrive: From flash drives to wireless stick by Kaushiv Agarwal
item.description: Technology changes very fast, from big computers to portable laptops; from snail-paced 2G to blazing-fast 4G. However, the most drastic change was in terms of storage of data: The Invention of the USB Drive. USB flash drives were invented at M-Systems, an Israeli company, and a US patent was filed on April 5, 1999, by […]

item.title: The Lost Legacy
item.description: Uncharted: The Lost Legacy Release Date: 22 August 2017 Platform: PlayStation 4 Developer: Naughty Dog This unexpected addition to the hit adventure game franchise has been highly entertaining and maintains the franchise’s reputation thoroughly. It has almost been a year since the fan-favorite Uncharted 4, with Nathan Drake’s final adventure came to a close. Naughty […]

item.title: COL. SANDERS’ NEW FLAGSHIP KILLER
item.description: It took a couple of re-reads to fully let the impact of the news sink in. At first, it was just words that registered: China, KFC, Phone. Then the concept fully began to connect. The Chinese are now making a KFC smartphone. Why are the Chinese now making a KFC smartphone? Don’t get me wrong, […]

item.title: Brain-Computer Interfaces by Angad Singh
item.description: Brain-Computer Interfaces: An Overview Picture this, it’s late at night and you have a big test tomorrow which you haven’t studied for. As you steadily move through the course material you wonder if there was a way by which you could just download information straight to your brain. That might be closer than you think. […]

item.title: Get With the Lingo by Aditya Joshi
item.description: What is it, really, that differentiates us from animals? Some would argue it’s our self-awareness, others would say it’s our capacity to think at a higher level, while others still would be adamant in their belief it’s the endless adaptiveness that humanity has that is our key advantage. But I believe the answer is a […]

item.title: Will Artificial Intelligence pose a threat to humanity
item.description: Artificial Intelligence or AI, refers to intelligent behavior exhibited by machines or programs. The term inspires so much enigma that over the last few years it has been one of the hottest topics of conversation. While AI has gained much more traction over the last decade, the concept has actually been around since 1950, when […]

item.title: Vice Principal Interview
item.description: Over the years, Exun has skyrocketed. I have personally seen Exun achieve several milestones over the years and break barriers, thus opening new horizons in technology at a school level. Constant support from both alumni and school authorities have allowed Exun to reach heights never reached before. We have continued to grow every year, both, […]

item.title: The Wonders of the Jailbreak
item.description: The Wonders of The Jailbreak You’ve probably heard the term “jailbreaking” at some point, but what exactly does it mean? The iOS operating system is like a close-walled garden, allowing somewhat limited functionality to the users. To jailbreak an iDevice means to exploit one or more bugs in order to remove software restrictions imposed by […]

item.title: Principal Interview-Ms. Vanita Sehgal
item.description: Exun Clan’s journey has been impressive, reaching unprecedented heights and showcasing the prosperity of our school. Being our school’s first club, it certainly paved the way for all such future endeavours. This year, SudoCrypt 7.0, Exun’s annual international online cryptic hunt, has received entries from over 20 countries and I believe this number will only […]

item.title: Teacher Interview( FOUNDER, IN-CHARGE EXUN )- Mr. Mukesh Kumar
item.description: The good thing about the growth of technology is that it has always been primarily to solve current real world problems and benefit all. Google Apps and Facebook’s internet.org are some of the best examples of this. It was with this thought that in 1965, Gordon Moore, one of the co-founders of Intel made a […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Mohit Dey
item.description: Mohit Dey on gaming in a student’s hectic and fast paced life. Although commonly believed to be a negative activity that students take part in, I believe that Gaming is one of the best stress busters and is very helpful in today’s faced-paced life. In my mind, gaming is simply a more fun way to […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Aashima Nagpal
item.description: Q: Aashima Nagpal – Competitive Programming in a student’s life A: In the not too far history, programming as a hobby was unheard of. But now it has been introduced to a newer student audience, thus opening a completely new horizon in their lives. Children are developing a sudden newfound interest for complex computational problem […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Shekhar Sharma
item.description: Q: How can we inculcate Cyber Safety in students at a young age? A: Students of this generation have a lot of exposure to electronic devices, which gives them access to the world of Internet, which has both sides, the good and the bad. A few months ago, a child from from class 5, came […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Hema Jain
item.description: Hema Jain on Internet Security after the advent of new home devices. In today’s world, we see that new types of home appliances are undergoing high growth. Companies like Amazon, Google, and Apple have entered this field with Apple Home, Google Home and Echo. While these products open a new horizon to the home technology […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Anjana Virmani
item.description: Q: How can Google Classroom be used increase educational productivity? A: Google Classroom has become a highly used suite of educational tools by Google in recent years and has been a gift for students and teachers alike. From printing out individual revision sheets and notes, teachers can now share these valuable resources with their students […]

item.title: Teacher Interview-Nandini Dasgupta
item.description: Nandini Dasgupta on the future growth in the IT Sector. In recent years, there has been a massive growth in the IT sector. Today, it is one of the biggest industries in the world, with most other industries being dependant on it. This growth, however, has been unconventional, it has been a startup and app […]

item.title: Teacher Interview- Ajit Kumar
item.description: Q- What is the future of robotics with reference to AI? Answer– In the field of robotics, our main goal is to imitate nature to the best of our ability. We started off by making the humanoid “Eric” which was our first attempt at imitating human beings. Robots are meant to work for us and […]
